Shadow Wing::
She looked down and sighed heavily.  She missed him a lot and wished 
to see him again. Then again, he may not recongnize her in her new 
form. She wondered if he would still be happy to see her in her new 
form. She looked at Veratis. "Yes, I understand. What am I supposed 
to do now? I'm not fully complete yet.  This form is still changing. 
and I don't know..." she stopped and doubled over as she clutched at 
her stomach.  Her internal circuits were in the last stages of 
generation.  She held onto the table for suport. She fell to her 
knees nd transformed into beast mode. The form was in finally stages 
of completetion.  Normall a bot is asleep through this and doesn't 
experience pain, but she was wide awake and going through the ordeal. 
She transformed into polar bear with the owl wings protruding from 
her shoulder blades. Her hands transformed into massive paws with 
huge claws.  Her white fur now covered her completely and her eyes 
were a pearcing bright blue. Her sence of smell and hearing was 
greatly increased and she roared out a bear roar as she finished her 
change.  She stood in beast mode and looked at Vertis. Her wings 
extended over her and her bear head up. She said in a shocked 
voice, "By the matrix...." 

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> "You can't reach him because your link was broken when I removed 
your spark
> from his old body." he figured that was a logical assumption to 
tell her.
> "Now you will just have to stop worrying about him for a while and 
start
> thinking about yourself. You have a very unexpected form and will 
need time
> to adjust. Lunarpine is a bigbot that can take care of himself."
> 
> Veratis studied the readings he'd been taking the whole time she was
> forming. He set down the results he'd found, turned to her looked 
her
> directly in the eyes. "Lunarpine promised he'd return for you. I 
think he'd
> crawl on his belly if he had to. Any bot who'd risk his own 
existence to
> carry two sparks isn't one to give up easily. He'll be back."
